create-new-test-template:
‚Ä¢ If you are a teacher of the currently selected group, you can edit the test template of this group.
‚Ä¢ If you want to create other templates, you can go to Groups in your Profile page and create new groups. 
‚Ä¢ Each group has its own test template.

new-test-help:
‚Ä¢ Press this button to take a test.
‚Ä¢ The test uses the template of the group you have currently selected.
‚Ä¢ If you are not in any group, you will receive the default test.
‚Ä¢ During the test, you have 15 seconds for each question.
‚Ä¢ You can take breaks by pressing the Pause button.
‚Ä¢ You can end the test by pressing the Stop button.
‚Ä¢ Pause or Stop will take effect only AFTER you answer the current question.

Revita will display the words you are learning ‚Äî as RED in your Vocabulary Progress View.

Practice your words with Flashcards!
Once you have learned them, words turn from RED to GREEN.
no-flashcards-yet-when-you-practice-a-st:
No flashcards yet for this story.
You can create flashcards in two ways:

  • You can add a flashcard for any words by clicking "Add new flashcard" button on the left

tour-welcome-message:
Revita helps you learn languages.
You can
  • Practice with any story of your choice,
  • Focus on particular grammar topics,
  • Expand your vocabulary,
  • And much more...

Click here any time to go to the Home Page.

This Tour highlights the main features.
Other pages offer you additional Tours to showcase more detail about their features!

Let us begin ‚Üí
tour-sidebar-message: Here you can open the Sidebar. It contains useful settings and functions.
tour-learning-language-message:
Here you can select the language you are learning.
You can change it any time.
tour-practice-now-message: Here you can start practicing with a random story.
tour-flashcards-message:
When you click on unfamiliar words you find inside stories, Revita automatically creates flashcards for them.

You can practice with these words here!
tour-library-message: The Library contains stories that you upload, stories from your teacher / class, and sample texts we have pre-loaded for you.
tour-add-content-message:
You can upload any stories of your choice, and use them for practising.
‚Üí They will appear in your private library.
tour-begin-practicing-message:
Now you can begin practicing!

Click the Tour icon on other pages‚Äîto take a tour of that page.

Please register and log in, so Revita can preserve your:
  • stories and flashcards,
  • settings and preferences,
  • skill levels and progress.

Bon voyage!
OLD TOUR:
Revita helps you learn languages, by practicing with stories of your choice.

We now show you some key features.

Let us begin!
(This tour will take 1 minute) →

controlled-exercise-popup-text:
Click the generated exercises (red) to select them for the tailored story. If you like the exercises you've selected, but want more exercises for the current snippet, you can edit the tailored story later.

Once you like all selected exercises for the current snippet (green), click "Freeze snippet" ‚Äî to save them and move on to the next snippet.

question: Question
test-start-modal-info-content: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.
adaptive-test-info-text:
The Quick Test helps you assess your skill level. Revita selects questions for you depending on how you do on the previous questions. The test will have about 50-75 questions, depending on your replies. Try to answer each question in 30 seconds or less!

At the end of the test, you will get a summary of your answers, and an estimate of your CEFR level!
exhaustive-test-info-text: The Long Test includes questions about topics chosen by the teacher. Try to answer each question within 30 seconds!
controlled-practice-info-text: Controlled. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco.

control-story-info-text: The exercises in this story are chosen by the teacher. Try to answer the exercises in each snippet before the timer reaches zero! In case of incorrect answers, you'll get extra time for additional attempts.

competition-mode-info-text: In competition mode, you will compete against a bot that has about the same skills as you. The competition will end when one of you reaches the end of the story ‚Äî the winner is the one who has more correct answers at that time!

reading-test-self-reflection-header: Please answer a couple of short questions:
first-time-meta-help-message: This was not the best option. We will now offer some help‚Ä¶
experimental-elicitation-question:
This task has several challenging points. Choose one. If you feel that the tips are not helpful, don't worry! You can choose different advice next time.
Which of these would you like to get more help with?
elicitation-construct-specific-details: I can‚Äôt find the right place in the text
elicitation-construct-deducing-vocabular: I don‚Äôt understand the meaning of some words
move-to-next-set-of-reading-items: Now we move to the next set of tasks.
experimental-after-first-mediation-open-: Did the feedback change the way you approach the task? How?
experimental-after-last-item-slider-ques: How useful do you think this feedback is after these tasks?
experimental-end-of-set-open-ended-quest: Did the feedback in the previous items change the way you read the texts? In what ways? (Note that you need to write something in the box here, and in the following questions, to go forward)
Did you get any new ideas about how to answer reading questions?
Tell us about your experiences with the chatbot. Did you ask anything from it? How useful did you find it? Did this change the way you read the texts?

control-end-of-set-open-ended-question-a: How certain were you of your answers?
control-end-of-set-open-ended-question-b: What kind of difficulties did you have?
control-end-of-set-open-ended-question-c: What kind of help would you wish for?

Home-Continue-Activity-EXPLANATION: Click here to resume where you left off in your previous practice ...
Home-Dive-In-EXPLANATION: Here Revita will quickly pick a text for you to practice ‚Äî based on your preferences
Home-Lessons-EXPLANATION: Click here to go to lessons on all grammar topics ‚Äî based on example sentences selected from random stories
Home-Adaptive-Test-EXPLANATION: Here you can take a quick test ‚Äî about 50-60 questions ‚Äî which will produce an estimate of your level of knowledge
Home-Flashcards-EXPLANATION: Here you can play with flashcards ‚Äî to improve your knowledge of vocabulary
Home-Library-EXPLANATION:
Click to go to the library to select stories:
  • Private: your own stories,
  • Group: stories uploaded by your teacher,
  • Public: a collection of shared stories
Sidebar-user-score-EXPLANATION: Your current level ‚Äî click to go to Progress View
flashcards-go-to-all-cards-EXPLANATION:
In this story, you saw some words and did not not ask for their translations. We want to assume that you probably know these words. We use these 5 special blue cards to check that you know all of these words. If you answer these 5 cards correctly, you will get credit for all the words you know in this story.
Click here if you want to go back to working with all your flashcards.
flashcards-edit-card-list-EXPLANATION: Here you can review and modify the complete list of your flashcards
flashcards-add-cards-EXPLANATION: Here you can add any new words you like to your flashcards
flashcards-translate-cards-EXPLANATION: Exercise with flashcards: translate words into the language you chose
flashcards-quick-cards-EXPLANATION: Click here for quick flashcards: no need to translate ‚Äî answer only "I know this word" or  "I don't know"
customize-lesson-configurations-EXPLAIN: Click here to configure the lesson: which topics do you want to practice?
customize-story-practice-EXPLAIN: Select what you would like to practice...
enter-question-to-chatbot: Ask a question from the chatbot ...
chatbox-initial-instruction: Click on an exercise ‚Äî then you can get hints here, and ask any questions you have about the exercise.
no-available-exercise-OLD: We have no more exercises for this lesson at the moment. Revita will create more exercises shortly ‚Äî please come back a bit later!
chatbot-response-error: A connection problem has occurred, please try again in 30 seconds!

word-nest-EXPLANATION: Click here to see the Word Nest ‚Äî related words.
DDLANG-onboarding-message: THIS IS AN OLD VERSION OF THE ABOVE INTRO TEXT (DONT USE THIS): The following exercises will help you improve your English skills. The first stage is reading comprehension ‚Äî 20 short tasks. We will also ask you what you think about the tasks and the feedback that you receive about them, so that we can improve the tasks. You don't have to complete all the tasks in one session; you can exit and return to them, and continue from the point where you left off. After completing the reading exercises, you can continue with various tasks that focus on structures and vocabulary. You will get detailed instructions about these tasks when you are ready to start working on them. Later, you will be able to continue practicing reading comprehension with new exercises; we will let you know when they are available.
click-on-words-near-the-exercises-to-exp: Click on any unfamiliar word to look up its meaning  ‚áí  the word will be saved into your flashcards!
select-lesson-themes-and-vocabulary: Select themes and level of vocabulary for lesson
click-here-to-configure-lesson: Click here to configure your lesson ‚Üí
disabled-flashcard-btn-explanation: This story has no flashcards yet ‚Äî click on words you don't know in the story to create flashcards!
lessons-not-ready-for-practice: Lesson is not yet configured for practice!
ddlang-introductory-text:
How does the Revita/DD-LANG system help you?
Revita/DD-LANG develops your English skills, particularly reading and writing. It also helps you to prepare for the Matriculation Examination.
You will receive feedback that helps you become better a reader/writer. If you get the same feedback many times, don't worry: It just helps you to remember the advice.
You can exit and come back to the exercises at any time.
What should you do next?
Start by choosing Reading Practice. Other activities (e.g. Flashcards, Library) are not yet ready for English. Take the Tour (upper right-hand corner of the screen) for more details.
Reading Practice includes two sets of 10 exercises. After completing them, you can practice your grammar and vocabulary. We will let you know when more reading (and also writing) exercises are ready for you.
TOS-title: Terms and Conditions, Privacy Policy, and Consent to Participate in Research
TOS-consent-title: Consent to Participate in Research Study
TOS-consent-content: By using the DD-LANG tasks in Revita, you agree to participate in our research study. You consent to the collection and use of your data for research purposes, as outlined in the privacy notices and research information provided below. Participation in this research is a requirement for using the DD-LANG tasks in Revita.
TOS-research-content: The purpose of this study is to improve the effectiveness of language learning. Your participation will involve the collection of data related to your use of the DD-LANG tasks, including what you do in the system, your performance metrics, and the feedback you give. Participation in this research is fully voluntary. You may withdraw your consent to participate in the research at any time and for any reason.
TOS-privacy-content:
We are committed to protecting your privacy. The data collected from your use of DD-LANG tasks will be used solely for research purposes and to improve our services. This data may include personally identifiable information such as your username, email address, and performance data. All data will be anonymized before any research analysis or reporting. Your data will be stored securely and will only be accessible to authorized researchers involved in this study. We will not share your personal information with any third parties without your explicit consent, except as required by law.
See X and Y for more information
TOS-background-questions-content: Before starting the exercises, we ask you to answer some background questions.
TOS-question-1: Question 1: How many years have you studied in lukio?
TOS-question-1-4: this is my fourth (or more) year
TOS-question-2a: Which obligatory English courses have you taken? Mark all that you have taken (including the one that you may be taking at the moment);
TOS-question-2b: Which optional English courses have you taken? Mark all that you have taken (including the one that you may be taking at the moment)
TOS-question-3: What is your latest course grade in English?
correct-first-attempts: Number of correct answers on first attempt (no hints)
first-attempt-correct-rate: Correct rate on first attempt (no hints)
overall-correct-rate: Rate of correct answers of all answers (including with hints)
average-hints-used: Average number of hints needed to get correct answer
test-completed: Report: Your performance on reading comprehension exercises
explain-your-performance: Your current level of performance on this topic
ddlang-introductory-text-experimental:
How does the Revita/DD-LANG system help you?
Revita/DD-LANG develops your English skills, particularly reading and writing. It also helps you to prepare for the Matriculation Examination.
You will receive feedback that helps you become better a reader/writer. You may get the same feedback many times: This helps you to remember the advice.
You can exit and come back to the exercises at any time. Just close the Revita window in your browser to exit.
What should you do next?
Start by choosing Reading Practice. Some of the other activities may not yet be ready for English. Take the Tour (upper right-hand corner of the screen) for more details.
Reading Practice includes two sets of 10 exercises. After completing them, you can practice your grammar and vocabulary by using texts in the Library or by using texts that you can upload to Revita yourself. We will let you know when more reading (and also writing) exercises are ready for you.
Remember that your goal is not to just to complete tasks but to learn something new from them.
You can change the language of the interface and feedback to Finnish in the Settings (via the menu in the upper left corner of the screen).
ddlang-introductory-text-control:
How does the Revita/DD-LANG system help you?
Revita/DD-LANG develops your English skills, particularly reading and writing. It also helps you to prepare for the Matriculation Examination.
You will receive feedback on how well you did on each exercise.
You can exit and come back to the exercises at any time. Just close the Revita window in your browser to exit.
What should you do next?
Start by choosing Reading Practice. Other activities (e.g. Flashcards) are not yet ready for English. Take the Tour (upper right-hand corner of the screen) for more details.
Reading Practice includes two sets of 10 exercises. We will let you know when more reading (and also writing) exercises are ready for you.
You can change the language of the interface and feedback to Finnish in the Settings (via the menu in the upper left corner of the screen).
DDLANG-onboarding-message-OLD:
THIS IS AN OLD VERSION OF THE ABOVE INTRO TEXT (DONT USE THIS):
The following exercises will help you improve your English skills. The first stage is reading comprehension ‚Äî 20 short tasks. We will also ask you what you think about the tasks and the feedback that you receive about them, so that we can improve the tasks. You don't have to complete all the tasks in one session; you can exit and return to them, and continue from the point where you left off. After completing the reading exercises, you can continue with various tasks that focus on structures and vocabulary. You will get detailed instructions about these tasks when you are ready to start working on them. Later, you will be able to continue practicing reading comprehension with new exercises; we will let you know when they are available.

flashcard-upload-instructions:
Please upload a text file containing your flashcards:
  • Select a file with extension .TXT or .DOCX (other extensions not supported)
  • The first line must contain the title of the flashcard pack
  • Each line contains one word/phrase, then translations, separated by semicolons; for example:
    • word;translation 1; translation 2; ...
